intro: Hymenoxys brandegeei, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Hymenoxys brandegeei is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
